title: telemetry/ganalytics
description:
Enterprise only. Generate API Analytics from your API activity, using Googleâ€™s Analytics platform as the storage backend.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/

buffer_size.title: Buffer size
buffer_size.description:
The size of the buffer determines how much data can be stored in memory. The default value is twice the number of workers. It must be at least twice the number of workers, otherwise it is automatically changed to the double.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/

tags.title: Tags
tags.description:
An object with key-values describing the tags you want to include when sending reports and their values. These tags are static.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/

timeout.title: Timeout
timeout.description: The time you will wait for the internal buffer to be avaiable before discarding a report.

track_id.title: Tracking ID
track_id.description:
The tracking ID as provided by Google. It is recommended to create a new property in Google Analytics to track the activity. It usually looks like UA-1234567.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/

url.title: Reporting URL
url.description:
The reporting URL where KrakenD sends the batches. Unless you need a custom backend endpoint, use `https://www.google-analytics.com/batch`.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/

workers.title: Number of workers
workers.description:
The number of internal workers that send the reports in batch.

See: https://www.krakend.io/docs/enterprise/telemetry/google-analytics/
